answerText: hydrostatic equilibrium [prompt on "equilibrium"][10] The Eddington limit is the maximum this quantity can be for a star in hydrostatic equilibrium. It is the total amount of energy radiated by a star per unit time.
heading: PADAWAN |2014 | 5 | 7 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This state is often described mathematically by taking a small cylinder and stating that the derivative of pressure with respect to length is equal to minus big G times mass times density all over length squared. [10] Name this state in which gravitational pressure is balanced by thermal pressure from nuclear reactions in a star.
